definition: according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before
to make a copy/to plagiarize/to search and seize/to raid/to grab/to go off with/to take a shortcut/to make a turning move/to fold one's arms

sentences.english: Please make a copy of this material.
sentences.chinese: 請你把這個材料照抄一份。

sentences.english: Then she took Li Hua's composition and copied it quickly.
sentences.chinese: 然後她拿出李華的作文，迅速的照抄一遍。

sentences.english: The idea for your story has to be original, not copied from something you've read.
sentences.chinese: 你的故事必須是原創，不得照抄以前讀過的故事。

definition: the attitude of mechanically borrowing (ideas etc)
to apply mechanically/to copy and use
lit. to draw a dipper with a gourd as a model (idiom)/fig. to copy slavishly
lit. drawing a tiger using a cat as a model (idiom); fig. to follow a model and get things more or less right but without capturing the spirit of the subject/uninspired imitation
to make a copy/to plagiarize/to search and seize/to raid/to grab/to go off with/to take a shortcut/to make a turning move/to fold one's arms
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
sticking unmoving to the original (idiom); not an iota changed/untouched
lit. to draw a dipper with a gourd as one's model (idiom)/fig. to follow the existing pattern without modification
to plagiarize/to copy/to attack the flank or rear of an enemy
literal/word by word and phrase by phrase
lit. to put Zhang's hat on Li's head/to attribute sth to the wrong person (idiom)/to confuse one thing with another
